name: dunk
content:
dunk verb [T]
(INTO LIQUID)
Add to word list
Add to word list
to put a biscuit, piece of bread, etc. into a liquid such as tea, coffee, or soup for a short time before eating it: She dunked a biscuit in her coffee.
informal to put something into liquid for a short time: Dunk the sponge in water every once in a while to stop it from drying out.

dunk verb [T]
(BASKETBALL)
US to slam-dunk

Add to word list
Add to word list
to put a cookie, bread, pastry, etc. into a liquid such as coffee or soup for a short time before eating it: She dunked her doughnut in her coffee.
If you dunk a person, you push the person under water: The kids in the pool kept dunking one another.
If you dunk a basketball, you score by jumping high enough to throw the ball down through the goal.
